text:
*Answered*
I've got this require_css inside a macro. I'm importing the macro into a file in another directory. Is the require relative to macro file's location or the importing file's location?

If it's relative to the reporting file's location, is there a variable I can use to refer to the macro file's location so I can load a file relative to that location? (If what I'm doing here looks asinine and ridiculous, I'm open to you telling me that in a kind and gentle way. Thanks.)
I don't understand the question. Can you elaborate or give an example?
TBH, I haven't tried this yet.

Answer:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions>
This method requires an absolute URL; CMS content with a known relative URL can be required by using the `get_asset_url()` function.
This works fine as well for my purposes
